ImageData.LabelName: Endometrial cancer has spread to parts of the body outside the pelvis:

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.SourceFilename: Endometrial Cancer Stage IVB FP III.2.jpg
OriginalSource.Comment: Updated skin tone to FP III; removed the brain; and changed the figure to a middle-aged female
Changed the wording in the text on the right side of the figure to say “…body outside the pelvis”.

Removed lines connecting the inset box to the primary tumor on the main figure; shaded in the area connecting the primary tumor in the inset box to the primary tumor on the main figure; changed label "Cancer in endometrium" to "Endometrium"
Used the Lung Rev. #4 body as the template; removed the breasts from main figure; added a colon at the end of the label “Endometrial cancer has spread…pelvis:”
Replaced metastasis inset with a new inset from the Metastasis image
Faded long bone in right leg.
Cut main figure off at the knees; added bracket to show Pelvis; changed wording under title.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IVB endometrial cancer; drawing shows cancer that has spread to parts of the body outside the pelvis, including the abdomen and lymph nodes in the groin. An inset shows cancer cells spreading from the endometrium, through the blood and lymph system, to another part of the body where metastatic cancer has formed.

Stage IVB endometrial cancer; drawing shows cancer that has spread to parts of the body outside the pelvis, including the abdomen and lymph nodes in the groin. An inset shows cancer cells spreading from the endometrium, through the blood and lymph system, to another part of the body where metastatic cancer has formed.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IVB endometrial cancer. The cancer has spread to parts of the body outside the pelvis, including the abdomen and/or lymph nodes in the groin.
Stage IVB endometrial cancer. The cancer has spread to parts of the body outside the pelvis, including the abdomen and/or lymph nodes in the groin.
